alert.note: Alert for Lebanon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 4:44PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN LEBANON COUNTY THROUGH 515 PM EDT... At 444 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Palmyra, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Palmyra, Annville, Cornwall, Campbelltown, Pleasant Hill, Sand Hill, Lebanon South, Cleona, Avon, Fredericksburg, Quentin, Timber Hills, Mount Gretna Heights, Harper Tavern, Lawn, Lickdale, Fort Indiantown Gap, Jonestown and Ono. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for south central Pennsylvania.
